abstract: Quest Diagnostics study published in journal Diabetes Care finds spike in number of new diabetes diagnoses among poor Americans in states that have embraced Affordable Care Act and have expanded Medicaid program; study suggests that law may be aiding thousands of people in receiving earlier treatment for condition.
lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that because of the Affordable Care Act, the disease is being diagnosed earlier in poor Americans.

headline.main: With Expansion of Medicaid, Some States Are Identifying More New Diabetes Cases
headline.print_headline: With Expansion of Medicaid, Some States Are Identifying More New Diabetes Cases

snippet: A new study suggests that because of the Affordable Care Act, the disease is being diagnosed earlier in poor Americans.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
